subclusters.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory focuses on dietary restriction effects mediated by Sir2 (sirtuins) and p53, linking calorie restriction to molecular genetic pathways involving sirtuins and hormonal regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes CR-induced activation of sirtuin-1 and autophagy, reducing inflammation and oxidative stress, fitting the sirtuin-centered CR mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR effects including sirtuin activation, autophagy, and metabolic/hormonal changes consistent with sirtuin and nutrient sensing pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CR’s modulation of sirtuins, AMPK, FOXO, and autophagy, highlighting conserved nutrient sensing and stress response pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR’s molecular and physiological responses including mTOR and insulin/IGF-1 signaling, with emphasis on CR mimetics and sirtuin-related pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR’s effects on IIS, TOR, and Ras-PKA pathways, stress resistance, and hormesis, consistent with sirtuin and nutrient sensing mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights CR’s activation of AMPK, sirtuins, and mTOR signaling pathways, linking metabolic improvements to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR’s modulation of immune function and inflammation via sirtuin pathways and gene regulation, fitting the sirtuin-centered CR theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes CR’s reduction of mitochondrial oxidative stress and activation of sirtuins and AMPK, consistent with sirtuin-p53 related CR mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR’s antioxidative effects, inflammation modulation, autophagy, and mitochondrial biogenesis, all linked to sirtuin and nutrient sensing pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR’s modulation of mTOR, immunometabolic checkpoints, and inflammaging, consistent with sirtuin and nutrient sensing mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction and Sirtuin-p53 Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CR’s effects on metabolic rate, oxidative stress, and biomarkers of longevity, fitting the sirtuin and nutrient sensing CR theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR’s metabolic remodeling in yeast, suppression of sulfur amino acid biosynthesis, and TOR1 pathway modulation, highlighting metabolic and TOR-centric mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CR’s slowing of metabolism and reduction of ROS production, emphasizing metabolic remodeling and protective responses linked to TOR signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights CR’s enhancement of mitochondrial stability and reduction of ROS in a fungal model, consistent with metabolic remodeling and mitochondrial maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR’s reduction of oxidative stress, apoptosis upregulation, immune modulation, and tumor suppression, fitting metabolic and mitochondrial remodeling themes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes calorie intake’s role in lifespan and disease delay, focusing on metabolic effects rather than macronutrient composition, consistent with metabolic remodeling.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes chronic energy intake restriction’s effects on immune function, cellular proliferation, and antioxidant defenses, fitting metabolic remodeling and immune maintenance.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR’s systemic effects on age-related pathology and metabolic pathways, consistent with metabolic remodeling and disease prevention.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights CR’s conserved effects on aging and age-related diseases in primates, emphasizing systemic metabolic remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses CR and drug therapy overlap in delaying aging diseases via metabolic and vascular risk factor modulation, fitting metabolic remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Calorie Restriction Metabolic Remodeling and TOR Pathway Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CR’s dose-dependent lifespan extension, healthspan improvement, and metabolic/hormonal modulation, consistent with metabolic remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Downregulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on CR-induced downregulation of insulin/IGF-1 signaling and youthful transcriptional profiles, highlighting IIS pathway modulation.
